Occurs when there is an unintended connection between two points in an electrical circuit, leading to excessive current flow.

Applying a higher voltage than specified can damage components.
Forcing an Arduino Uno into HID compliance can render the board useless if not done correctly.
Connecting a microcontroller directly to a PC can lead to overcurrent situations that may fry the PC's USB ports.
